cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY1S GOVERNMENT)...COPY - NO a ylCABINET. , PRIVATE MEMBERS' BILLS. Note by the Secretary.,In pursuance of Cabinet 5(26), Conclusion 4, it has been the practice to place on the Agenda for the Cabinet any Bills to be introduced in the House of Commons as Private Members' Bills on the Friday following the particular meeting of the Cabinet.The Parliamentary Secretary to the Treasury has suggested that Private Members' Bills should in. future be placed on the Agenda a week in advance of the date of their consideration in the House of Commons ao as to give adequate time for the necessary arrangements to be made to give effect to Cabinet decisions regarding such Bills. "The Prime Minister proposes to adopt this suggestion forthwith.(Signed) M.P.A. HAWKEY,Secretary, Cabinet.SECRET. CP. 52(27) .2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1. 15th February, 1927.
